channel.title: Activities on Cub Scouts Pack499
channel.description: Recent content in Activities on Cub Scouts Pack499

item.title: Popcorn
item.description: Popcorn program is the only money earning activity once a year allows the Scouts to raise funds to pay their own way through scouting, including summer camps, equipment, and other experience. Scout with the help of Registered Adult Partner creates an account in Trail’s End and co-ordinate with the Pack Popcorn chair to participate in the program. Logistics for Popcorn program: Create account in Train’s End. Signup for the shifts (Max 2 per Scout) in Trail’s End.

item.title: Pinewood Derby
item.description: Register here by Dec 20th to confirm your participation! Since it was first introduced in 1953 by Don Murphy, a Cubmaster in California, Pine Wood Derby(PWD) has become one of the most popular and favorite activity for cubscouts. It is one of the most celebrated tradition in Cubscouts. Pack499 had a blasting performance in 2022 with multiple awards in various categories. PWD is about creativity, innovation and parent/caregiver - scout collaboration span multiple weeks to build a car from a single piece of derby and compete among the cubscouts.

item.title: Council
item.description: There are many activities organized at council level. SignUP and participate. SVMBC website
